items.title: Fictiv and MISUMI report on the state of manufacturing, supply chain digitalization
items.summary: MISUMI Americas finds that AI, digital platforms, and regional resilience are priorities for industrial modernization. The post Fictiv and MISUMI report on the state of manufacturing, supply chain digitalization appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: Integrated motion control enables sophisticated robot motion
items.summary: Integrated motion control allows all kinds of robots to tackle a range of tasks with precision, in contrast with conventional machinery. The post Integrated motion control enables sophisticated robot motion appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: Visual drone detection moves into critical infrastructure playbooks
items.summary: Learn how operators of critical infrastructure are leveraging advanced technologies to combat the increasing commonality of drone-related incidents. The post Visual drone detection moves into critical infrastructure playbooks appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: Ghost Robotics: Innovating for safety
items.summary: Gavin Kenneally, co-founder and CEO of Ghost Robotics, discusses the design and function of the Vision 60 quadruped robots in the latest podcast episode. The post Ghost Robotics: Innovating for safety appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: CapNav: Benchmarking Vision Language Models on Capability-conditioned Indoor Navigation
items.summary: Vision-Language Models (VLMs) have shown remarkable progress in Vision-Language Navigation (VLN), offering new possibilities for navigation decision-making that could benefit both robotic platforms and human users. However, real-world navigation is inherently conditioned by the agent's mobility constraints. For example, a sweeping robot cannot traverse stairs, while a quadruped can.

items.title: Snapping Actuators with Asymmetric and Sequenced Motion
items.summary: Snapping instabilities in soft structures offer a powerful pathway to achieve rapid and energy-efficient actuation. In this study, an eccentric dome-shaped snapping actuator is developed to generate controllable asymmetric motion through geometry-induced instability. Finite element simulations and experiments reveal consistent asymmetric deformation and the corresponding pressure characteristics.

items.title: NORD releases digital twin simulation platform for robotics developers
items.summary: NORD said it allows engineers to verify whether the drive concept is suitable for the system early in the planning phase. The post NORD releases digital twin simulation platform for robotics developers appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: How Fast Can I Run My VLA? Demystifying VLA Inference Performance with VLA-Perf
items.summary: Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models have recently demonstrated impressive capabilities across various embodied AI tasks. While deploying VLA models on real-world robots imposes strict real-time inference constraints, the inference performance landscape of VLA remains poorly understood due to the large combinatorial space of model architectures and inference systems.

items.title: Learning to Tune Pure Pursuit in Autonomous Racing: Joint Lookahead and Steering-Gain Control with PPO
items.summary: Pure Pursuit (PP) is widely used in autonomous racing for real-time path tracking due to its efficiency and geometric clarity, yet performance is highly sensitive to how key parameters-lookahead distance and steering gain-are chosen. Standard velocity-based schedules adjust these only approximately and often fail to transfer across tracks and speed profiles.

items.title: Ori-Sense: origami capacitive sensing for soft robotic applications
items.summary: This work introduces Ori-Sense, a compliant capacitive sensor inspired by the inverted Kresling origami pattern. The device translates torsional deformation into measurable capacitance changes, enabling proprioceptive feedback for soft robotic systems. Using dissolvable-core molding, we fabricated a monolithic silicone structure with embedded conductive TPU electrodes, forming an integrated soft capacitor.

items.title: Zero-shot Interactive Perception
items.summary: Interactive perception (IP) enables robots to extract hidden information in their workspace and execute manipulation plans by physically interacting with objects and altering the state of the environment -- crucial for resolving occlusions and ambiguity in complex, partially observable scenarios.

items.title: Downwash-aware Configuration Optimization for Modular Aerial Systems
items.summary: This work proposes a framework that generates and optimally selects task-specific assembly configurations for a large group of homogeneous modular aerial systems, explicitly enforcing bounds on inter-module downwash. Prior work largely focuses on planar layouts and often ignores aerodynamic interference.

items.title: Tendon-Driven Reciprocating and Non-Reciprocating Motion via Snapping Metabeams
items.summary: Snapping beams enable rapid geometric transitions through nonlinear instability, offering an efficient means of generating motion in soft robotic systems. In this study, a tendon-driven mechanism consisting of spiral-based metabeams was developed to exploit this principle for producing both reciprocating and non-reciprocating motion.

items.title: Diff2DGS: Reliable Reconstruction of Occluded Surgical Scenes via 2D Gaussian Splatting
items.summary: Real-time reconstruction of deformable surgical scenes is vital for advancing robotic surgery, improving surgeon guidance, and enabling automation. Recent methods achieve dense reconstructions from da Vinci robotic surgery videos, with Gaussian Splatting (GS) offering real-time performance via graphics acceleration.

items.title: Learning Smooth Time-Varying Linear Policies with an Action Jacobian Penalty
items.summary: Reinforcement learning provides a framework for learning control policies that can reproduce diverse motions for simulated characters. However, such policies often exploit unnatural high-frequency signals that are unachievable by humans or physical robots, making them poor representations of real-world behaviors.

items.title: Amazon Robotics shuts down Blue Jay sortation project
items.summary: Amazon Robotics grounded the Blue Jay project after only six months, redirecting resources to other fulfillment projects. The post Amazon Robotics shuts down Blue Jay sortation project appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: Role-Adaptive Collaborative Formation Planning for Team of Quadruped Robots in Cluttered Environments
items.summary: This paper presents a role-adaptive Leader-Follower-based formation planning and control framework for teams of quadruped robots operating in cluttered environments. Unlike conventional methods with fixed leaders or rigid formation roles, the proposed approach integrates dynamic role assignment and partial goal planning, enabling flexible, collision-free navigation in complex scenarios.

items.title: RoEL: Robust Event-based 3D Line Reconstruction
items.summary: Event cameras in motion tend to detect object boundaries or texture edges, which produce lines of brightness changes, especially in man-made environments. While lines can constitute a robust intermediate representation that is consistently observed, the sparse nature of lines may lead to drastic deterioration with minor estimation errors.

items.title: SimVLA: A Simple VLA Baseline for Robotic Manipulation
items.summary: Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models have emerged as a promising paradigm for general-purpose robotic manipulation, leveraging large-scale pre-training to achieve strong performance. The field has rapidly evolved with additional spatial priors and diverse architectural innovations.

items.title: Design and Characterization of a Dual-DOF Soft Shoulder Exosuit with Volume-Optimized Pneumatic Actuator
items.summary: Portable pneumatic systems for 2 degree-of-freedom (DOF) soft shoulder exosuits remain underexplored, and face fundamental trade-offs between torque output and dynamic response that are further compounded by the need for multiple actuators to support complex shoulder movement.

items.title: Have We Mastered Scale in Deep Monocular Visual SLAM? The ScaleMaster Dataset and Benchmark
items.summary: Recent advances in deep monocular visual Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM) have achieved impressive accuracy and dense reconstruction capabilities, yet their robustness to scale inconsistency in large-scale indoor environments remains largely unexplored.

items.title: GrandTour: A Legged Robotics Dataset in the Wild for Multi-Modal Perception and State Estimation
items.summary: Accurate state estimation and multi-modal perception are prerequisites for autonomous legged robots in complex, large-scale environments. To date, no large-scale public legged-robot dataset captures the real-world conditions needed to develop and benchmark algorithms for legged-robot state estimation, perception, and navigation.

items.title: Interacting safely with cyclists using Hamilton-Jacobi reachability and reinforcement learning
items.summary: In this paper, we present a framework for enabling autonomous vehicles to interact with cyclists in a manner that balances safety and optimality. The approach integrates Hamilton-Jacobi reachability analysis with deep Q-learning to jointly address safety guarantees and time-efficient navigation.

items.title: OODBench: Out-of-Distribution Benchmark for Large Vision-Language Models
items.summary: Existing Visual-Language Models (VLMs) have achieved significant progress by being trained on massive-scale datasets, typically under the assumption that data are independent and identically distributed (IID). However, in real-world scenarios, it is often impractical to expect that all data processed by an AI system satisfy this assumption.

items.title: Dynamic Deception: When Pedestrians Team Up to Fool Autonomous Cars
items.summary: Many adversarial attacks on autonomous-driving perception models fail to cause system-level failures once deployed in a full driving stack. The main reason for such ineffectiveness is that once deployed in a system (e.g., within a simulator), attacks tend to be spatially or temporally short-lived, due to the vehicle's dynamics, hence rarely influencing the vehicle behaviour.

items.title: EgoPush: Learning End-to-End Egocentric Multi-Object Rearrangement for Mobile Robots
items.summary: Humans can rearrange objects in cluttered environments using egocentric perception, navigating occlusions without global coordinates. Inspired by this capability, we study long-horizon multi-object non-prehensile rearrangement for mobile robots using a single egocentric camera.

items.title: Contact-Anchored Proprioceptive Odometry for Quadruped Robots
items.summary: Reliable odometry for legged robots without cameras or LiDAR remains challenging due to IMU drift and noisy joint velocity sensing. This paper presents a purely proprioceptive state estimator that uses only IMU and motor measurements to jointly estimate body pose and velocity, with a unified formulation applicable to biped, quadruped, and wheel-legged robots.

items.title: Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada to deploy Agility Robotics’ Digit humanoids
items.summary: Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada is expanding its commercial trials for Digit from three humanoids to 10. The post Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada to deploy Agility Robotics’ Digit humanoids appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: NVIDIA adds Cosmos Policy to its world foundation models
items.summary: Cosmos Policy is a new robot control policy that post-trains the Cosmos Predict-2 world foundation model for manipulation tasks. The post NVIDIA adds Cosmos Policy to its world foundation models appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: MALLVI: A Multi-Agent Framework for Integrated Generalized Robotics Manipulation
items.summary: Task planning for robotic manipulation with large language models (LLMs) is an emerging area. Prior approaches rely on specialized models, fine tuning, or prompt tuning, and often operate in an open loop manner without robust environmental feedback, making them fragile in dynamic settings.MALLVi present a Multi Agent Large Language and Vision framework that enables closed loop feedback driven robotic manipulation.

items.title: Ottonomy builds Ottumn.AI platform to orchestrate robots, drones, and smart infrastructure
items.summary: Ottonomy built Ottumn.AI on NVIDIA's infrastructure to integrate delivery systems for healthcare, logistics, and smart cities. The post Ottonomy builds Ottumn.AI platform to orchestrate robots, drones, and smart infrastructure appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: igus launches new RBTX online shopping experience for robotics developers
items.summary: This shift to a self-serve model removes the requirement for a sales consultation, providing a streamlined experience, igus said. The post igus launches new RBTX online shopping experience for robotics developers appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: Mitsubishi Electric follows digital-first strategy for advanced air mobility
items.summary: Mitsubishi Electric United States is focused on helping companies with digital-first initiatives such as AnyMile for drone cargo management. The post Mitsubishi Electric follows digital-first strategy for advanced air mobility appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: NVIDIA and Global Industrial Software Leaders Partner With India‚Äôs Largest Manufacturers to Drive AI Boom
items.summary: India is entering a new age of industrialization, as AI transforms how the world designs, builds and runs physical products and systems. The country is investing $134 billion dollars in new manufacturing capacity across construction, automotive, renewable energy and robotics, creating both a massive challenge and opportunity to build software-defined factories from day one. At Read Article

items.title: Medtronic earns FDA clearance for Stealth AXiS spinal surgery system
items.summary: Medtronic built the Stealth AXiS system to support a wide range of surgeon preferences, clinical complexity, and care settings. The post Medtronic earns FDA clearance for Stealth AXiS spinal surgery system appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: IFR releases position paper on AI in robotics
items.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming the robotics field at a rapid pace, according to the International Federation of Robotics or IFR. The post IFR releases position paper on AI in robotics appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: ARM Institute opens project call for military supply chain technology
items.summary: The Office of the Secretary of Defense is working with the ARM Institute and other manufacturing innovation institutes on this project. The post ARM Institute opens project call for military supply chain technology appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: How motor design enables different types of robots
items.summary: Advances in motor design have allowed different types of robots to both specialize for industrial functions and converge in precision. The post How motor design enables different types of robots appeared first on The Robot Report .

items.title: CLOT: Closed-Loop Global Motion Tracking for Whole-Body Humanoid Teleoperation
items.summary: Long-horizon whole-body humanoid teleoperation remains challenging due to accumulated global pose drift, particularly on full-sized humanoids. Although recent learning-based tracking methods enable agile and coordinated motions, they typically operate in the robot's local frame and neglect global pose feedback, leading to drift and instability during extended execution.

items.title: Upside Robotics is reducing fertilizer use and waste in corn crops
items.summary: Upside Robotics builds autonomous solar-powered robots that can help farmers reduce their fertilizer use by 70%.

items.title: Into the Omniverse: Physical AI Open Models and Frameworks Advance Robots and Autonomous Systems
items.summary: Open source has become essential for driving innovation in robotics and autonomy. By providing access to critical infrastructure ‚Äî from simulation frameworks to AI models ‚Äî NVIDIA is enabling collaborative development that accelerates the path to safer, more capable autonomous systems.

items.title: Prosthetic Hand Manipulation System Based on EMG and Eye Tracking Powered by the Neuromorphic Processor AltAi
items.summary: This paper presents a novel neuromorphic control architecture for upper-limb prostheses that combines surface electromyography (sEMG) with gaze-guided computer vision. The system uses a spiking neural network deployed on the neuromorphic processor AltAi to classify EMG patterns in real time while an eye-tracking headset and scene camera identify the object within the user's focus.

items.title: How YC-backed Bucket Robotics survived its first CES
items.summary: Now, the startup is turning its attention to building the business, fundraising, and striking commercial deals.

items.title: Oshen built the first¬†ocean¬†robot to collect data in a¬†Category 5 hurricane
items.summary: Oshen has signed contracts with multiple government agencies for its C-Star robots to collect ocean data autonomously.

items.title: AI‚Äôs Next Revolution: Multiply Labs Is Scaling Robotics-Driven Cell Therapy Biomanufacturing Labs
items.summary: Startup works with leading cell therapy companies to bring robotics manufacturing into the clean room, reducing costs by more than 70% while accelerating output compared with legacy systems.

items.title: Inside CES 2026’s ‚Äúphysical AI‚Äù takeover
items.summary: After years of chatbots and image generators, AI is finally leaving the screen. At CES 2026, that shift became impossible to ignore.  The annual tech showcase in Las Vegas was dominated by “physical AI” and robotics, from Boston Dynamic’s newly redesigned Atlas humanoid robot to AI-powered ice makers (yes, really). The companies in attendance clearly want consumers […]

items.title: Japan Science and Technology Agency Develops NVIDIA-Powered Moonshot Robot for Elderly Care
items.summary: The next universal technology since the smartphone is on the horizon ‚Äî and it may be a little less pocket friendly. The Moonshot research program, funded by the Japan Science and Technology Agency and accelerated by NVIDIA AI and robotics technologies, is working to create a world by 2050 where AI-powered, autonomously learning robots are Read Article

items.title: Steel, Sensors and Silicon: How Caterpillar Is Bringing Edge AI to the Jobsite
items.summary: At CES, Caterpillar reveals how it‚Äôs integrating NVIDIA technologies, from NVIDIA Jetson Thor to speech models, to transform the world‚Äôs heavy industries.

items.title: From Warehouse to Wallet: New State of AI in Retail and CPG Survey Uncovers How AI Is Rewiring Supply Chains and Customer Experiences
items.summary: AI has transformed retail and consumer packaged goods (CPG) operations, enhancing customer analysis and segmentation to enable greater personalization for marketing and advertising, and boosting the speed and accuracy of demand forecasting for supply chains and logistics. Companies are also raising the bar for customer engagement through intelligent digital shopping assistants and catalog enrichment by Read Article

items.title: NVIDIA Unveils New Open Models, Data and Tools to Advance AI Across Every Industry
items.summary: Expanding the open model universe, NVIDIA today released new open models, data and tools to advance AI across every industry. These models ‚Äî spanning the NVIDIA Nemotron family for agentic AI, the NVIDIA Cosmos platform for physical AI, the new NVIDIA Alpamayo family for autonomous vehicle development, NVIDIA Isaac GR00T for robotics and NVIDIA Clara Read Article

items.title: Pickle Robot adds Tesla veteran as¬†first¬†CFO
items.summary: Jeff Evanson recently joined Pickle Robot as the company's first CFO as the startup has allegedly expanded its partnership with UPS.

items.title: Into the Omniverse: OpenUSD and NVIDIA Halos Accelerate Safety for Robotaxis, Physical AI Systems
items.summary: Physical AI is moving from research labs into the real world, powering intelligent robots and autonomous vehicles (AVs) ‚Äî such as robotaxis ‚Äî that must reliably sense, reason and act amid unpredictable conditions.

items.title: Cheers to AI: ADAM Robot Bartender Makes Drinks at Vegas Golden Knights Game
items.summary: In Las Vegas‚Äôs T-Mobile Arena, fans of the Golden Knights are getting more than just hockey ‚Äî they‚Äôre getting a taste of the future. ADAM, a robot developed with NVIDIA Isaac libraries, is pouring drinks and turning heads in one of the NHL‚Äôs most exciting venues. ADAM, short for Automated Dual Arm Mixologist, was developed Read Article

items.title: 1X¬†struck a deal to send its ‘home’ humanoids to¬†factories and warehouses
items.summary: Despite launching as a humanoid robot designed to help consumers around the house, 1X's Neo robots are heading to industrial use cases.

items.title: Robots‚Äô Holiday Wishes Come True: NVIDIA Jetson Platform Offers High-Performance Edge AI at Festive Prices
items.summary: Editor‚Äôs note: This blog has been updated to showcase additional recent innovations tapping into the NVIDIA Jetson platform. Developers, researchers, hobbyists and students can take a byte out of holiday shopping this season as NVIDIA has unwrapped special discounts on the NVIDIA Jetson family of developer kits for edge AI and robotics ‚Äî available through Read Article

items.title: NVIDIA and AWS Expand Full-Stack Partnership, Providing the Secure, High-Performance Compute Platform Vital for Future Innovation
items.summary: At AWS re:Invent, NVIDIA and Amazon Web Services expanded their strategic collaboration with new technology integrations across interconnect technology, cloud infrastructure, open models and physical AI. As part of this expansion, AWS will support NVIDIA NVLink Fusion ‚Äî a platform for custom AI infrastructure ‚Äî for deploying its custom-designed silicon, including next-generation Trainium4 chips for Read Article

items.title: At NeurIPS, NVIDIA Advances Open Model Development for Digital and Physical AI
items.summary: Researchers worldwide rely on open-source technologies as the foundation of their work. To equip the community with the latest advancements in digital and physical AI, NVIDIA is further expanding its collection of open AI models, datasets and tools ‚Äî with potential applications in virtually every research field. At NeurIPS, one of the world‚Äôs top AI Read Article

items.title: This Khosla-backed startup can track drones, trucks, and robotaxis, inch by inch
items.summary: Point One Navigation, now valued at $230 million, is building out well beyond automotive.

items.title: Powering AI Superfactories, NVIDIA and Microsoft Integrate Latest Technologies for Inference, Cybersecurity, Physical AI
items.summary: Timed with the Microsoft Ignite conference running this week, NVIDIA is expanding its collaboration with Microsoft, including through the adoption of next-generation NVIDIA Spectrum-X Ethernet switches for the new Microsoft Fairwater AI superfactory, powered by the NVIDIA Blackwell platform. The collaboration brings new integrations across Microsoft 365 Copilot, as well as the public preview of Read Article

items.title: A Neuromorphic Architecture for Scalable Event-Based Control
items.summary: This paper introduces the ``rebound Winner-Take-All (RWTA)" motif as the basic element of a scalable neuromorphic control architecture.

items.title: Nemotron Labs: 3 Ways to Bring Agentic AI to Computer Vision Applications
items.summary: Editor‚Äôs note: This post is part of the Nemotron Labs blog series, which explores how the latest open models, datasets and training techniques help businesses build specialized AI systems and applications on NVIDIA platforms. Each post highlights practical ways to use an open stack to deliver real value in production ‚Äî from transparent research copilots Read Article

items.title: Why¬†a researcher¬†is building robots that look and act like bats
items.summary: These palm-sized robots use ultrasound signals to navigate harsh conditions in search and rescue missions.

items.title: AI researchers ’embodied’ an LLM into a robot ‚Äì and it started channeling Robin Williams
items.summary: AI researchers at Andon Labs embedded various LLMs in a vacuum robot to test how ready they were to be embodied. And hilarity ensued.

items.title: Into the Omniverse: Open World Foundation Models Generate Synthetic Worlds for Physical AI Development
items.summary: Physical AI models ‚Äî which power robots, autonomous vehicles and other intelligent machines ‚Äî must be safe, generalized for dynamic scenarios and capable of perceiving, reasoning and operating in real time.

items.title: NVIDIA GTC Washington, DC: Live Updates on What‚Äôs Next in AI
items.summary: Monday, Oct. 27, 12:30 p.m. ET How Medium-Sized Cities Are Tackling AI Readiness üîó A panel discussion today at GTC Washington, D.C., highlighted a public-private initiative to invigorate the economy of Rancho Cordova, California, with a focus on AI. To bolster innovation, the city is working with the Human Machine Collaboration Institute and NVIDIA on Read Article

items.title: Fueling Economic Development Across the US: How NVIDIA Is Empowering States, Municipalities and Universities to Drive Innovation
items.summary: To democratize access to AI technology nationwide, AI education and deployment can‚Äôt be limited to a few urban tech hubs ‚Äî it must reach every community, university and state. That‚Äôs why NVIDIA is working with cities, states and educational institutions to embed AI education and innovation across the U.S., with the goal of helping the Read Article

items.title: NVIDIA IGX Thor Robotics Processor Brings Real-Time Physical AI to the Industrial and Medical Edge
items.summary: AI is moving from the digital world into the physical one. Across factory floors and operating rooms, machines are evolving into collaborators that can see, sense and make decisions in real time. To accelerate this transformation, NVIDIA today unveiled NVIDIA IGX Thor, a powerful, industrial-grade platform built to bring real-time physical AI directly to the edge, Read Article

items.title: NVIDIA Launches Open Models and Data to Accelerate AI Innovation Across Language, Biology and Robotics
items.summary: Furthering its deep commitment to open source, NVIDIA is unveiling new open-source AI technologies for language, robotics and biology ‚Äî contributing to an open ecosystem that broadens access to AI and fuels U.S. innovation. These open technologies will empower developers worldwide and strengthen economic growth through efficient reasoning, high-fidelity world generation and interactive physical AI Read Article

items.title: Coco¬†Robotics¬†taps UCLA professor to lead new physical AI research lab
items.summary: Coco Robotics is working toward automating its fleet of delivery robots using its millions of miles of collected data.

items.title: The world is just¬†not quite ready¬†for humanoids yet
items.summary: Despite the amount of money being injected into the industry, humanoids won't be able to learn dexterity -- or the fine motor movements with hands -- rendering them essentially useless.

items.title: SoftBank bulks up its robotics portfolio¬†with¬†ABB Group‚Äôs robotics unit
items.summary: SoftBank says this acquisition will help it dive deeper into robotics as it considers physical AI to be the next frontier.

items.title: Geometric Backstepping Control of Omnidirectional Tiltrotors Incorporating Servo-Rotor Dynamics for Robustness against Sudden Disturbances
items.summary: This work presents a geometric backstepping controller for a variable-tilt omnidirectional multirotor that explicitly accounts for both servo and rotor dynamics. Considering actuator dynamics is essential for more effective and reliable operation, particularly during aggressive flight maneuvers or recovery from sudden disturbances.

items.title: Former OpenAI and DeepMind researchers raise whopping $300M seed to automate science
items.summary: Periodic Labs has raised from a tech industry who's who, including Andreessen Horowitz, Nvidia, Elad Gil, Jeff Dean, Eric Schmidt, and Jeff Bezos.

items.title: Safe Planning in Unknown Environments Using Conformalized Semantic Maps
items.summary: This paper addresses semantic planning problems in unknown environments under perceptual uncertainty. The environment contains multiple unknown semantically labeled regions or objects, and the robot must reach desired locations while maintaining class-dependent distances from them. We aim to compute robot paths that complete such semantic reach-avoid tasks with user-defined probability despite uncertain perception.

items.title: Learning Adaptive Pseudo-Label Selection for Semi-Supervised 3D Object Detection
items.summary: Semi-supervised 3D object detection (SS3DOD) aims to reduce costly 3D annotations utilizing unlabeled data. Recent studies adopt pseudo-label-based teacher-student frameworks and demonstrate impressive performance. The main challenge of these frameworks is in selecting high-quality pseudo-labels from the teacher's predictions.

items.title: Live demo fails, AI safety wins, and the golden age of robotics
items.summary: This week on Equity, Anthony Ha, Kirsten Korosec, and Max Zeff unpack the biggest moves in AI, robotics, and regulation. Listen to the full episode to hear about: Equity will be back next week. Subscribe wherever you get your podcasts! Equity is TechCrunch‚Äôs flagship podcast, produced by Theresa Loconsolo, and posts every Wednesday and Friday. […]

items.title: Why Runway is eyeing the robotics industry for future revenue growth
items.summary: Runway is building up a robotics-focused team and fine-tuning its existing models for robotics and self-driving car customers.

items.title: Tesla is reportedly behind on its pledge to build 5,000 Optimus bots this year
items.summary: Tesla is behind on its goal to produce at least 5,000 Optimus humanoid robots by the end of 2025.

items.title: How TRIC Robotics is reducing pesticide use on strawberries using UV light
items.summary: TRIC Robotics just raised a $5.5 million seed round for its tractor-sized robots that help eliminate bacteria and pests on strawberry plants.

items.title: Diligent Robotics hires two notable Cruise alumni to its leadership team
items.summary: Diligent Robotics hired Cruise's former chief operating officer and former head of AI and robotics into c-suite positions.

items.title: Hugging Face opens up orders for its Reachy Mini desktop robots
items.summary: Hugging Face is releasing two versions of its desktop robot meant for designing and coding AI applications.

items.title: View Invariant Learning for Vision-Language Navigation in Continuous Environments
items.summary: Vision-Language Navigation in Continuous Environments (VLNCE), where an agent follows instructions and moves freely to reach a destination, is a key research problem in embodied AI. However, most existing approaches are sensitive to viewpoint changes, i.e. variations in camera height and viewing angle.

items.title: When Digital Twins Meet Large Language Models: Realistic, Interactive, and Editable Simulation for Autonomous Driving
items.summary: Simulation frameworks have been key enablers for the development and validation of autonomous driving systems. However, existing methods struggle to comprehensively address the autonomy-oriented requirements of balancing: (i) dynamical fidelity, (ii) photorealistic rendering, (iii) context-relevant scenario orchestration, and (iv) real-time performance.

items.title: SoftBank reportedly looking to launch a trillion-dollar AI and robotics industrial complex
items.summary: The investing conglomerate is looking to team up with TSMC on the initiative as SoftBank continues to pour money into AI.

items.title: Eye-tracking-Driven Shared Control for Robotic Arms: Wizard of Oz Studies to Assess Design Choices
items.summary: Advances in eye-tracking control for assistive robotic arms provide intuitive interaction opportunities for people with physical disabilities. Shared control has gained interest in recent years by improving user satisfaction through partial automation of robot control. We present an eye-tracking-guided shared control design based on insights from state-of-the-art literature.

items.title: eStonefish-Scenes: A Sim-to-Real Validated and Robot-Centric Event-based Optical Flow Dataset for Underwater Vehicles
items.summary: Event-based cameras (EBCs) are poised to transform underwater robotics, yet the absence of labelled event-based datasets for underwater environments severely limits progress in tasks such as visual odometry and obstacle avoidance. Real-world event-based optical flow datasets are scarce, resource-intensive to collect, and lack diversity, while no prior benchmarks target underwater applications.

items.title: ConformalNL2LTL: Translating Natural Language Instructions into Temporal Logic Formulas with Conformal Correctness Guarantees
items.summary: Linear Temporal Logic (LTL) is a widely used task specification language for autonomous systems. To mitigate the significant manual effort and expertise required to define LTL-encoded tasks, several methods have been proposed for translating Natural Language (NL) instructions into LTL formulas, which, however, lack correctness guarantees.

items.title: CAIMAN: Causal Action Influence Detection for Sample-efficient Loco-manipulation
items.summary: Enabling legged robots to perform non-prehensile loco-manipulation is crucial for enhancing their versatility. Learning behaviors such as whole-body object pushing often requires sophisticated planning strategies or extensive task-specific reward shaping, especially in unstructured environments.

items.title: Fusion of Visual-Inertial Odometry with LiDAR Relative Localization for Cooperative Guidance of a Micro-Scale Aerial Vehicle
items.summary: A novel relative localization approach for guidance of a micro-scale Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) by a well-equipped aerial robot fusing Visual-Inertial Odometry (VIO) with Light Detection and Ranging (LiDAR) is proposed in this paper.
